meanings.sent1: The magician performed a trick where he made a coin dematerialize before our eyes.
meanings.sent2: As the sun set, the colors of the sky started dematerializing into darkness.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone was so delicious that it seemed to dematerialize in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her worries about the upcoming test dematerialized as she focused on studying.
meanings.sent5: The snowman slowly dematerialized under the warm rays of the sun.

meanings.definition: To convert into a non-material form
meanings.sent1: The scientist's invention could dematerialize physical objects into digital data.
meanings.sent2: The futuristic technology allowed for dematerializing solid matter into energy.
meanings.sent3: The recipe book had a magical spell to dematerialize ingredients for instant cooking.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was so strong that it seemed to dematerialize into beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to dematerialize into a masterpiece on the canvas.
